holidays.name: World Cancer Day
holidays.description: A global initiative to raise awareness, improve education, and encourage research in the fight against cancer.
holidays.origin: Established by the Union for International Cancer Control (UICC) in 2000 to unite the world in the fight against cancer.
holidays.funFact: Despite its serious intent, many participants organize quirky events like cancer-themed costume runs to engage the community!

holidays.name: Create a Vacuum Day
holidays.description: A playful, pseudo-scientific day dedicated to the idea of making a perfect vacuum‚Äîbecause who doesn't want an excuse to talk about physics and space?
holidays.origin: Origin unknown, likely started by science enthusiasts fascinated with the concept of vacuum.
holidays.funFact: While we can't create a perfect vacuum on Earth, the day inspires creative experiments in a lot of classrooms worldwide!

holidays.name: Thank a Mailman Day
holidays.description: Express gratitude to the hardworking mail carriers who deliver our letters, packages, and occasional bills with a smile.
holidays.origin: An unofficial holiday celebrated mainly in the United States as a recognition of postal workers' efforts.
holidays.funFact: February is often chosen because it‚Äôs one of the coldest months, so thanking a mailman then is extra sweet!

holidays.name: Tater Tot Day
holidays.description: A celebration of the beloved crispy, golden potato treat known as Tater Tots! Perfect day to indulge in this snack or try some creative recipes.
holidays.origin: Officially recognized in the United States to honor the invention of Tater Tots by the Ore-Ida company in 1953.
holidays.funFact: There are now gourmet versions of Tater Tots topped with everything from cheese and jalape√±os to pulled pork!
